intro: Paleya billotioides, commonly known as the narrow-leaf paleya, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its botanical features include hairy stems and capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Paleya billotioides is often found in moist, shaded habitats within tropical forests.
